    Available estimators ('type') A Descriptive Table 1
  • Changelog

Turn tibble into gt Table with Custom Formatting

Source: R/rt_gt.R
rt_gt.Rd

Formatting includes:

  • Text align to top/left

  • Smaller row padding

  • No top border

  • Bold column labels

Usage

rt_gt(df, md = NULL, indent = c(10, 20), remove_border = TRUE)

Arguments

df

Data frame/tibble

md

Optional. If not NULL, then the given columns will be printed with markdown formatting, e.g., md = c(1, 3) for columns 1 and 3.

indent

Optional. Detects labels (first columns in a rifttable) that start with two or four spaces and ensures indenting via tab_style. Defaults to 10 and 20 pixels for two or four spaces (c(10, 20)). Set to NULL to turn off. (Note that gt currently does not seem to support four-space indents in columns with markdown formatting, e.g., md = 1.)

remove_border

Optional. For indented lines, remove the upper horizontal border line? Defaults to TRUE.

Value

Formatted gt table

Example Output

Examples

data(mtcars)
mtcars %>%
  dplyr::slice(1:5) %>%
  rt_gt()
#> <div id="tlegrrqssy" style="padding-left:0px;padding-right:0px;padding-top:10px;padding-bottom:10px;overflow-x:auto;overflow-y:auto;width:auto;height:auto;">
